text.p: These are the leading stories in Zimbabwe's state-owned Herald newspaper on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- The Netherlands on Tuesday gave Zimbabwe four grants worth around Z$330 million to support the southern African country's education and health systems and the second phase of its economic reform programme.

- The Zimbabwean government on Tuesday reaffirmed its stance that junior doctors and nurses who were dismissed for going on strike to press for better wages and working conditions must individually re-apply for their jobs.

- Information, posts and telecommunications minister Joyce Mujuru says public relations and advertising companies should complement the government's efforts in marketing Zimbabwe as an investment destination.
